ygData.subject: Re: Owlhawk's training
ygData.msgSnippet: She came nearer to him. She was not instinctively harsh or cruel, but her tone showed that she was to be listened to. Owlhawk may be a warrior, but she was

She came nearer to him. She was not instinctively harsh or cruel, but 
her tone showed that she was to be listened to. Owlhawk may be a 
warrior, but she was more. She was a Wolf Warrior, and she had to 
break him from the tactics and habits he was used to make him into 
something more.

Katya: Neg. A Clan warrior that is not prepared, mentally or 
physically is as good as the freebirth scum populating the bandit 
caste. You must learn to be ready at all times.

She eased her tone. She had rebuked him, and now was the time to 
instruct him.

Katya: The Clan rituals have two goals; the first one is honor. The 
forces meeting in a Trial meet in a circle of equals. This way, we 
fight zellbringen, single combat. I admit that necessity may prevent 
us from always achieving single combat, but honor does not diminish 
this way. The second reason for Trials is that it prevents waste. The 
Clans have survived their birthing because they reduced wastes of 
all kind to a minimum. Remember that. Now... What do you do if a 
superior gives an order to raze a forest to make more place for a 
military compound?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> OOC:  Sorry I thought they were going to wait until
> they talked to Rodimus.
> 
> BIC:  Owlhawk moved over and stood at attention in
> front of her.
> 
> Owlhawk:  I assume to prepare your warrior both
> mentally and physically for combat.
> 
> --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Katya: What are you doing, you freebirth slag? Move
> > your circuits over 
> > here! Tell me why you think ritual trials are
> > important to us.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> > wrote:
> > > Owlhawk was under the impression the conversation
> > was
> > > over and just leaned against the wall.
> > > 
> > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > Katya seemed happy of the decision.
> > > > 
> > > > Katya: Good. I will speak with Rodimus about
> > this.
> > > > If he does not want 
> > > > me to train you, I will challenge him to a more
> > > > serious trial.
> > > > 
> > > > She waited for Owlhawk's reaction.
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > Owlhawk:  Allow me a moment to answer that.
> > > > > 
> > > > > He once again goes inside his mind to speak
> > with
> > > > Owl.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Hawk:  What do you think?
> > > > > 
> > > > > Owl:  Well, it might be refreshing to look at
> > a
> > > > > totally different state of mind that this
> > training
> > > > > would offer.  Besides they're not asking us to
> > > > totally
> > > > > give up being a Maximal.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Hawk:  Very well.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Back in the real world.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Owlhawk:  Very well.
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > Ragnar turned to Katya and nodded.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Ragnar: I will go and warn Rodimus of the
> > > > outcome of
> > > > > > this trial.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > He walks away, making the ground tremble
> > > > slightly
> > > > > > with every step.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Katya: He sees true in your potential. You
> > are
> > > > > > strong. However, being 
> > > > > > a Clansman... err... Clansbot in your case,
> > that
> > > > is
> > > > > > more than 
> > > > > > techniques. It is a lot of training, and
> > > > probably a
> > > > > > major change of 
> > > > > > minds. We Clans value zellbringen, single
> > > > combat.
> > > > > > Even in a melee, we 
> > > > > > tend to engage no more than one enemy at the
> > > > time.
> > > > > > Also, honor is 
> > > > > > above everything else in every aspect of our
> > > > life...
> > > > > > except maybe 
> > > > > > politics, but that is easily answered
> > through
> > > > > > combat. Are you willing 
> > > > > > to become a Clan Warrior?
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > > > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > Owlhawk braced himself and put his hands
> > in
> > > > front
> > > > > > of
> > > > > > > him to absorb most of the shock of running
> > > > into
> > > > > > the
> > > > > > > wall.  Then he stood up and faced them.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Owlhawk:  Verywell, I'm open to new
> > > > techniques.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...>
> > wrote:
> > > > > > > > The punch threw the female warrior far
> > away.
> > > > As
> > > > > > she
> > > > > > > > tried to get up, 
> > > > > > > > she could not totally conceal her pain.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Katya: I applaud you, Owlhawk. You do
> > have
> > > > the
> > > > > > > > Wolf's soul and the 
> > > > > > > > Bear's strenght. You have bested me in
> > this
> > > > > > contest.
> > > > > > > > We will work as 
> > > > > > > > part of the Maximals as of now.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Ragnar's towering form came next to her.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Ragnar: You are a powerful warrior,
> > Owlhawk,
> > > > and
> > > > > > I
> > > > > > > > have been thinking. 
> > > > > > > > I believe that you could serve the
> > Maximals
> > > > even
> > > > > > > > better if we steep 
> > > > > > > > you in the ways of the Clans. If Katya
> > does
> > > > not
> > > > > > > > agree, I will be your 
> > > > > > > > trainer. What say you?
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > >
